course_description: Investigate the limitations behind traditional approaches to racial discrimination in economics; explore the history of anti-Black racism in the US and its economic consequences, and consider how understanding of systemic racism could lead to pragmatic policy solutions to racial inequities.
prerequisites: ECON 101 or ECON_OX 101 or FIN 201 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 3254, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: D. McMillon, Status: Open
